comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: It's George Helgesen Fitch (5 June 1877 - 9 August 1915). He was an American author, humorist and journalist. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Helgesen_Fitch The photo is reproduced in The evening world, December 09, 1911, Final Edition, page 4 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030193/1911-12-09/ed-... An obituary was published in the The commoner., September 01, 1915, page 30 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/46032385/1915-09-01/ed-1/...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Another article about Fitch (with photo) "Being Funny Is Serious: Fitch Relaxes on Tears" in The Washington times., July 01, 1914, HOME EDITION, Image 3 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1914-07-01/ed-... Articles from G. Fitch e.g. "THUS IT IS" in The Day book., June 16, 1914, LAST EDITION, Page 20 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045487/1914-06-16/ed-... The Washington times., October 11, 1912, LAST EDITION, Page 15, "PETEY SIMMONS FROM SHIWASH IS SOME FAN" chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1912-10-11/ed-... "THE PET TOWN of JUPITER CITY" in The San Francisco call., April 20, 1913, page 71 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85066387/1913-04-20/ed-...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @B-59: I agree.  The pictures confirm it.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: B-59 and swanq:  Thanks for unearthing and confirming additional information on Fitch.  We'll include some of it next time we update the description.
